page.title: 08Margam Park. Margam Castle
page.content: The house designed by the architect Thomas Hopper was built between 1830 - 40 for Christopher Rice Mansel-Talbot and his family. Sold by order of the estate trustees in 1942 it was requisitioned and used by American soldiers. Unoccupied from the end of the second World War it was largely neglected and gutted by fire in August 1977. Restoration is taking place. The north wing has been rebuilt and refurbished for use as offices with plans for converting ground floor rooms to recreate the furnishings and atmosphere of such living quarters in the heyday of the castle. The entrance hall and staircase tower has also been re-roofed. Outbuildings house an exhibition, shop, restaurant and audio visual theatre.
